oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Johnny Rodriguez - Music City Album Review - Biff Collie - 1989-05-23
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording of a music city album review, featuring Johnny Rodriguez (performer/songwriter) and Biff Collie (host) on May 23, 1989.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Johnny Rodriguez talks about the first track on the album and having fond memories about recording it with the songwriter, Hellman -- Rodriguez talks about his recording Riding The Thumb To Mexico and a mixing incident in the studio -- Rodriguez talks about his recording Love Me With All Your Heart -- Rodriguez talks about Just Get Up And Close The Door and his relationship with the songwriter -- Rodriguez talks about Practice Makes Perfect, and recalls his first time hearing it and how impressed he was -- Rodriguez talks about Larry Gatlin -- Rodriguez talks about I Wonder If I Ever Said Goodbye, written by Mickey Goodbury [unconfirmed] -- Rodriguez talks about thinking his voice was too low for that tune -- Rodriguez talks about I Want To Wake Up With You and who brought him the tune -- Rodriguez talks about Forgiving You Was Easy and how he was the first one to record it, and Willie Nelson showed him the song and ended up recording it himself -- Rodriguez talks about You Always Come Back To Hurting Me, and recalls writing it on the tour bus with Tom T. Hall -- Rodriguez talks about The Last Letter, written by Rex Griffin and talks about the story behind it -- Rodriguez talks about What Do I Tell Virginia and how it was one of his favorite songs, in terms of the story the lyrics tell -- Rodriguez talks about We Believe In Happy Ending, and thinking at first it was too gentle -- Rodriguez talks about That's The Way Love Goes, and recalls a night hanging out with several other country artists, and Merle Haggard and Lefty Frizzell pitched the tune, Merle later recorded it as well -- Rodriguez talks about I Couldn't Be Me Without You, written by Billy Joe Shaver -- Rodriguez talks about Hillbilly Heart, written by Dan Penn and how it sounded weird at first but ended up loving the arrangement -- Rodriguez talks about Here I Am Again, and recalls spending time with Shell Silverstein -- Rodriguez talks about Fools For Each Other, written by Rodriguez and Bill Bowling and Rodriguez talks about the process of writing it -- Rodriguez talks about Down On The Rio Grande, also written by Rodriguez and Bowling and he talks about how it was their first collab -- Rodriguez talks about Desperado, and talks about the first time he heard The Eagles, Rodriguez talks about being the only one to cover the tune as a single -- Rodriguez talks about Dance With Me One More Time, and dedicating it to an old girlfriend -- Rodriguez talks about Back To Stay, written by Rodriguez and Keith Stegall (incomplete)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Collie, Biff; Rodriguez, Johnny, 1951-;
